org.schwering.evi.util
Class HTMLPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
                  javax.swing.JEditorPane
                      org.schwering.evi.util.HTMLPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.Scrollable, java.io.Serializable
public class HTMLPane
extends javax.swing.JEditorPane
implements javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener

A simple HTML frame with hyperlinks and simple history. The previous website can be obtained by pressing 'b'.

Version:
$Id: HTMLPane.java 235 2006-06-04 21:57:39Z schwering $
Author:
Christoph Schwering (schwering@gmail.com)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

HTMLPane

public HTMLPane()
Creates a new empty HTML frame.

HTMLPane

public HTMLPane(java.lang.String resource)
Creates a new HTML frame with the content of a resource.

Parameters:
resource - The resource which should be displayed. This means it must be contained in the JAR which also contains the HTMLPane (i.e. not in a seperate module).

HTMLPane

public HTMLPane(java.lang.Class cls,
                java.lang.String resource)
Creates a new HTML frame with the content of a resource.

Parameters:
cls - The class whose classloader is used to access the resource.
resource - The resource which should be displayed. This means it must be contained in the JAR which cls.

HTMLPane

public HTMLPane(java.net.URL url)
Creates a new HTML frame which displays the content behind the given URL.

Parameters:
url - The URL whose content should be displayed.

setPage

public void setPage(java.net.URL url)
Tries to load a page. The old page is NOT added to history in this method.

Parameters:
url - The new page's URL.
